title: Guava Puree Recipe for Babies
content:
Guava is very good in vitamin C and helps to improve the immune system. This makes a great baby food too.

 

Things to remember:

 

1)The texture of the puree depends upon you, I would recommend you to make the puree smooth.   

2)Your baby won't empty the whole bowl all at once, start with few spoons then increase it gradually as days pass by.

3)In my opinion and experience, guava won't cause any constipation in babies. I feed this puree once a week. 

4) I don’t prefer freezing purees. I make it fresh every day. 

5)Remove the seeds from the guava completely. 

6)Cooking the guava before feeding makes digestion easy.

 

How to sterilize baby feeding bowls:  

Start by sterilizing the bowls and spoons which you are going to feed your baby. Take the bowl and spoon in a large saucepan, cover it with water and bring them to a boil. Boil it rapidly for 5 mins. Now you can turn the heat off and leave them to stay in the hot water till use. 

 

How to make Steamed Mashed Banana:

Take ripe guava. It has to be fresh and ripe. Peel them and cut the cheeks of them.

Use a spoon to scoop the seeds from them.

Now take all the flesh in a saucepan, add a splash of water and cover it and simmer for 5 mins or till it is cooked.

Pierce with a knife to see whether it is cooked. If you go in easily then it is cooked.

Put them in a blender and puree them. You can add some clean water to adjust the consistency.

Pour this into sterilized clean bowls and feed your baby.
